contexts.text: ['A los ﬁ nes de calcular la tasa promedio de homicidios para cada país se consideran los siguientes años disponibles : Argentina , 1990 a 1995 ; Brasil , 1990 a 1999 ; Chile , 1990 a 1994 y 1997 ; Colombia , 1992 a 1999 y Venezuela , 1990', 'a 1999 .', 'c Los datos correspondientes al período 2000–2005 provienen de la Organización Panamericana de la Salud, Indicadores Básicos 2005, indicadores de mortalidad.', 'd Comisión Económica para América Latina y el Caribe (CEPAL).', 'Panorama Social 2004:', 'Evolución de algunos indicadores socioeconómicos, 1990–2003.', 'Promedio simple del período.', 'e Comisión Económica para América Latina y el Caribe (CEPAL).', 'Panorama Social 2004:', 'Evolución de algunos indicadores socioeconómicos, 1990–2003.', 'Valores absolutos correspondientes a los años 1990 y 2002.', 'f Fondo de las Naciones Unidas para la Infancia (UNICEF).', 'Tasa por cada 1.000 nacidos vivos correspondiente a cada uno de los años 1990 y 2003.', 'g Comisión Económica para América Latina y el Caribe (CEPAL).', 'Anuario estadístico 2004.', 'Sobre la base de cifras a precios constantes de 1995.', 'Un caso de corrupción como impuesto a la inseguridad.', 'La desmilitarización de las compras policiales en Argentina Marco general.']

['En el período 1990–1999 no se observa demasiada vinculación entre la tasa de desempleo y la de homicidios dolosos : Argentina tiene la tasa de desempleo más alta ( 11,9 % ) , sin embargo , en el ranking de homicidios se ubica en el cuarto lugar con 4 por', '100.000 .', 'Brasil, por su parte, con una tasa de desempleo del 5,6% (quinto puesto), tiene la segunda tasa más alta de homicidios dolosos de los países analizados.', '•', 'Se observa mayor relación en el período 2000–2003.', 'De los países con mayores niveles de desempleo, Colombia (17,4%), Argentina (16,8%) y Venezuela (15,3%), lideran la tasa de homicidios dolosos en el período 2000–2005.', 'Relación con el porcentaje de personas por debajo de la línea de la pobreza : 1990–2002e • En el período 1990–2002 , el porcentaje de personas por debajo de la línea de la pobreza se incrementó en dos de los países analizados : Argentina ( 95 % ) y Venezuela', '( 22 % ) .', 'Brasil y Colombia presentan descensos de alrededor del 10%.', 'Chile muestra una reducción signiﬁ cativa, de 38,6% (1990) a 18,8% (2002), es decir, del orden del 50%.', '•', 'Al comienzo de la década de los años noventa, los tres países que encabezan el porcentaje de personas por debajo de la línea de la pobreza, Colombia (56,1%), Brasil (41,5%)']

['The book "¿Cuál es la salida? La agenda inconclusa de la seguridad ciudadana" by Erik Alda and Gustavo Beliz provides a comprehensive analysis of violence prevention and citizen security in Latin America and the Caribbean. The authors advocate for a paradigm shift in addressing the persistent issue of insecurity, emphasizing the need for holistic policies, multi-stakeholder involvement, and robust evaluation mechanisms. The book delves into past and present initiatives while envisioning a future with more effective responses to the alarming statistics of violence in the region. It offers valuable insights into the challenges and opportunities for creating a safer and more secure environment for citizens in the region, emphasizing the need for transparency, accountability, and the integration of socio-economic factors in addressing the complex issue of violence and insecurity. The authors also discuss various programs and initiatives in countries like Colombia, Argentina, and Nicaragua, providing a detailed analysis of their impact and effectiveness in addressing violence through the education system. Overall, the book presents a compelling argument for a more holistic and integrated approach to citizen security and violence prevention in the region, offering valuable lessons and recommendations for policymakers, practitioners, and researchers.']

['La tasa de homicidios en la Ciudad de Buenos Aires fue de 3,32 cada 100.000 habitantes en 2019 (Ministerio de Justicia y Seguridad de la Ciudad de Buenos Aires, 2020).', 'Esta tasa es baja en comparación con el promedio de Argentina (5,3) y de Sudamérica (21).12 El gráfico 5 muestra el promedio móvil de 15 días de la cantidad de homicidios denunciados desde enero de 2018 hasta noviembre de 2020.', 'No observamos ningún cambio notable en los patrones de homicidio después del inicio del confinamiento del 20 de marzo de 2020 (línea discontinua vertical).', 'Gráfico 5.', 'Número semanal de homicidios denunciados en la Ciudad de Buenos Aires Fuente: cálculos de los autores basados en datos del Ministerio de Justicia y Seguridad de la Ciudad de Buenos Aires (Argentina).', 'Notas: media móvil de 15 días.', 'La línea discontinua marca el inicio de la cuarentena (20 de marzo de 2020).', 'De igual forma, evaluamos formalmente el impacto del confinamiento en los homicidios estimando los modelos de regresión lineal descritos anteriormente.', 'El cuadro 2 muestra los resultados de las estimaciones.', 'No encontramos un impacto significativo del confinamiento en el 12 Tasa de homicidios en Argentina y Sudamérica referida a 2018 (Fuente: Portal de datos de la UNODC, https://dataunodc.un.org/content/data/homicide/homicide-rate).', '18']

['El documento de trabajo del BID Nº IDB - WP-1245 ofrece un análisis detallado sobre el impacto del COVID-19 en la seguridad ciudadana de la Ciudad de Buenos Aires. Durante la cuarentena, se observó una significativa disminución del delito, afectando las denuncias oficiales, detenciones policiales y victimización reportada en encuestas. Sin embargo, el número de homicidios no mostró cambios significativos. Además, se destacó cómo la delincuencia se volvió "más local" durante la pandemia, con una reducción en la proporción de detenidos de fuera de la Ciudad de Buenos Aires.

El análisis se basó en datos históricos oficiales sobre delitos y detenciones policiales, así como en encuestas de victimización. Los resultados mostraron que, si bien la delincuencia comenzó a recuperarse tras la caída inicial, hasta noviembre de 2020 no había alcanzado los niveles anteriores a la cuarentena. Este estudio contribuye a la literatura sobre el impacto de la pandemia en la delincuencia, proporcionando valiosas lecciones sobre cómo el confinamiento afectó los patrones de movilidad de los delincuentes y la dinámica de la delincuencia en diferentes áreas de la ciudad.

Por otra parte, América Latina, una región con un alto nivel de desigualdad y delincuencia, se ha visto especialmente afectada, tanto en términos sanitarios como económicos. El impacto global a largo plazo de la pandemia de COVID-19 en la delincuencia es muy incierto y exige un estrecho seguimiento de la dinámica de la delincuencia de cara al futuro.']

expected_output: The homicide rate in Argentina was reported to be 5.3 per 100,000 inhabitants in 2018, which is higher than the rate in the City of Buenos Aires, where it was 3.32 per 100,000 inhabitants in 2019. This rate in Buenos Aires is considered low compared to the average for South America, which is 21 per 100,000 inhabitants. Notably, there were no significant changes in homicide patterns during the COVID-19 lockdown that began in March 2020, indicating stability in the homicide rate during that period [Source 4].

input.question: Cuáles son las brechas de genero en Colombia?

contexts.text: ['Colombia 56 1 67 27 Ecuador Ecuador 92 1 40 64 Perú Perú 125 58 43 31 Venezuela Venezuela 1 71 77 57 2021 2006 2021 2006 Fuente :', 'Índice global de brecha de género (Foro Económico Mundial).', 'La región andina presenta heterogeneidades importantes en los diferentes subíndices de brecha de género.', 'En el caso del logro educativo , Colombia ha alcanzado la paridad total de género , al igual que otros diez países latinoamericanos , mientras que Bolivia y Perú son los más rezagados de la región y no han mejorado su posición con respecto al 2006 , a pesar de', 'tener una paridad del 98,1 % .', 'La salud sigue un patrón similar a la educación, donde Bolivia se encuentra en el último lugar entre los países de América Latina, aunque cuenta con un nivel de paridad del 96,2%.', 'En el caso de la participación económica, la heterogeneidad en la región es impulsada principalmente por la proporción de mujeres que ocupan cargos altos, que para el caso de Colombia es la misma que de hombres, mientras que en Bolivia solo el', '29,2% de cargos altos son ocupados por mujeres y este número equivale al 40% en América Latina.', 'Por el contrario, Bolivia tiene el mejor desempeño de la región andina en cuanto a empoderamiento 5 Los números del gráfico indican el puesto relativo con respecto al grupo de 156 países, siendo los países en la posición 1 los que tienen una menor brecha de género.']

['En un momento de transformación global sin precedentes, la región andina se encuentra en un punto crucial de su desarrollo. La urgencia de abordar el cambio climático, la digitalización acelerada y la automatización de los procesos productivos marca un hito importante en la agenda mundial. La ratificación del Acuerdo de París y la reafirmación de los compromisos climáticos en la COP26 impulsan la descarbonización y la adopción de políticas sostenibles. Además, la pandemia del COVID-19 ha acelerado la digitalización y la automatización, transformando la forma en que se producen bienes y servicios a nivel global. Estos cambios presentan riesgos y oportunidades para el empleo y la estructura productiva de la región andina. En este contexto, el Banco Interamericano de Desarrollo ha elaborado un estudio que analiza los sectores clave que se verán afectados por estas transformaciones, como la agricultura, las cadenas de valor, los servicios, las industrias extractivas, la digitalización y la inclusión. El objetivo es ofrecer recomendaciones para aprovechar las oportunidades y mitigar los riesgos, promoviendo una transición productiva sostenible y equitativa en la región andina.']

['En 2000, después de ocho años de discusión, Colombia adoptó una medida de acción afirmativa, la Ley de Cuotas,91 que ha sido clave para incrementar la participación de las mujeres en las altas esferas de la Administración pública.', 'El caso colombiano se destaca porque la ley no solo establece cuotas, sino que además fija sanciones por incumplimiento, un caso único en la región.', 'Los números parecen indicar que está funcionando.', 'No solo porque el país se encuentra en los primeros puestos de la región en términos de presencia de mujeres en cargos de liderazgo ( 47 % ) , muy cercano a la paridad , sino que , además , presenta una distribución similar en los cuatro niveles de la', 'jerarquía y en los distintos sectores , rompiendo con los estereotipos de género .', 'Señales de que se está rompiendo con la segregación horizontal y vertical.', 'El impacto de las cuotas de género debe estudiarse en más detalle, pero indudablemente se destacan sus resultados.', 'PORCENTAJE DE MUJERES EN PUESTOS DE LIDERAZGO POR NIVEL Ministro', 'Nivel 1 46,2% Colombia se encuentra cerca de una participación paritaria.', 'La presencia y distribución de mujeres no muestra segregación horizontal ni vertical.', 'Nivel 2 Viceministro']

['El informe "Cómo acelerar el crecimiento económico y fortalecer la clase media en Colombia" ofrece un análisis detallado sobre los desafíos y oportunidades para el desarrollo sostenible en el país. Coordinado por expertos de renombre, el informe se centra en aspectos clave como el desarrollo de infraestructura, la política fiscal, la colaboración público-privada y la promoción de la clase media. Presenta propuestas concretas para impulsar el crecimiento económico y fortalecer la clase media en Colombia, ofreciendo una visión integral de la situación socioeconómica del país, destacando logros y desafíos en el siglo XXI. El informe destaca la importancia de retomar una senda de crecimiento económico sostenido para consolidar las mejoras en la calidad de vida de la población, especialmente en la consolidación de la clase media, que puede traer una mayor prosperidad para el país. Además, se resalta la necesidad de replantear las políticas sociales para atender los retos que enfrenta la clase media emergente, con el fin de garantizar su estabilidad económica y protección frente a riesgos.']

['Esto ha venido acompañado de una incursión progresiva de la mujer en distintos sectores económicos y un mayor grado de escolaridad con respecto a los hombres (Arango et al., 2016).', 'Por ramas de actividad, la mayor proporción de mujeres empleadas se concentra en los sectores de servicios comunales, sociales y personales.', 'No obstante, a pesar de los avances recientes, las mujeres continúan mostrando resultados desventajosos con relación a los hombres en el mercado de trabajo.', 'Así, según datos de la CEPAL (2017), Colombia presentó en 2016 una brecha de desempleo femenino de 4,2 puntos porcentuales, mientras que el promedio de América Latina y el Caribe (ALC) fue del 2,3%.', 'Por otra parte, los distintos sectores económicos enfrentan retos con respecto a su compromiso con la sostenibilidad productiva y la mitigación de los impactos ambientales.', 'Colombia presenta un bajo desempeño en el uso de recursos naturales que limitan su productividad y competitividad (DNP, 2019a; BID, 2019).', 'Si bien en los últimos años distintos sectores productivos del país han avanzado paulatinamente en la adopción de mejores prácticas productivas con miras a reducir su impacto', 'ambiental y la generación de gases de efecto invernadero (GEI), aún existen retos que deben afrontar.', 'El sector agropecuario colombiano , por ejemplo , muestra una baja productividad con relación al uso de la tierra ( BID , 2019 ) , presenta pérdidas de agua del 50 % , en promedio , en los sistemas de riego y genera una alta emisión de gases de efecto']

['El informe "Mujeres líderes en el sector público de América Latina y el Caribe: Brechas y Oportunidades" ofrece una visión detallada sobre la participación de las mujeres en puestos de liderazgo en la Administración pública. Destacando la importancia de la igualdad de género en el sector público, el informe revela los beneficios económicos, sociales y de eficiencia que conlleva una mayor presencia femenina en roles de toma de decisiones. Además, proporciona un análisis exhaustivo de la situación actual en 15 países de la región, identificando desafíos y oportunidades para cerrar las brechas de género.']

expected_output: En Colombia, las brechas de género se manifiestan en varios aspectos. Aunque el país ha alcanzado la paridad total en el logro educativo, las mujeres aún enfrentan desventajas en el mercado laboral, con una brecha de desempleo femenino de 4,2 puntos porcentuales en 2016, superior al promedio de América Latina y el Caribe, que fue del 2,3% [Source 5]. A pesar de que las mujeres ocupan el 47% de los cargos de liderazgo en la administración pública, lo que indica un avance hacia la paridad, persisten desafíos en la participación económica, especialmente en la ocupación de cargos altos, donde la proporción de mujeres es similar a la de hombres en Colombia, pero significativamente menor en otros países de la región [Source 3]. Además, las mujeres tienden a concentrarse en sectores de servicios, lo que refleja una segregación horizontal en el mercado laboral [Source 5].

input.question: What is climate finance?

contexts.text: ['By financing climate-smart infrastructure, NDBs have the opportunity to bridge the sustainable infrastructure finance gap.', 'Green finance includes financing renewable energy, energy efficiency, and low-carbon transport.', 'NDBs are responsible for about 6 percent of all green investments in LAC , of a total of US$ 10 billion in green finance annually in the region ( Abramskiehn , Hallmeyer , Trabacchi , et al . , 2017 ; IDFC , 2018 ; Smallridge , Buchner , Trabacchi', ', et al . , 2013 ) .', '5 Argentina, Belize, Bolivia, Brazil, Chile, Colombia, Costa Rica, Ecuador, El Salvador, Guatemala, Guyana, Honduras, Mexico, Nicaragua, Panama, Paraguay, Peru, Dominican Republic, Trinidad and Tobago, and Uruguay.', '6 Economic Infrastructure Investment Data in Latin America and the Caribbean.', '34', 'A Guidebook for National Development Banks on Climate Risk Several LAC NDBs have become leaders and innovators in structuring financial strategies for green investments in their own countries and on the global scale.', 'An example is shown in Case Study 5.', 'Box 3.2.', 'Green Finance Green finance is the provision of medium- to long - term debt , capital , grant instruments , and technical assistance to support countries in diversifying their economies toward a low - carbon development path , to finance long - term productive investments , to diversify sources of', 'capital , and to develop the technical capacity of local stakeholders .', 'The IDB, with its long-standing relationship of more than 40 years with NDBs, has recently increased its green financing.', '*', 'Between 2008 and 2018, the IDB’s total green finance lending to NDBs was US$2.1 billion, including technical assistance for 59 green projects and loan operations with 39 NDB partners.']

['The guidebook "A Guidebook for National Development Banks on Climate Risk" offers a comprehensive roadmap for National Development Banks (NDBs) to navigate the challenges and opportunities posed by climate change. Authored by a team of experts, the guidebook equips NDBs with the necessary tools to understand, assess, and manage climate-related financial risks. It emphasizes the urgency of addressing climate-related risks and highlights the potential impact on macroeconomic and financial stability. The guidebook draws attention to the ongoing efforts of financial regulators and supervisors to incorporate climate change into their strategies, recognizing it as a systemic risk. Furthermore, it provides practical examples and emerging practices from NDBs in Latin America and the Caribbean, aiming to inspire and accelerate climate risk efforts. The guidebook serves as a vital resource for NDBs, offering insights, guidance, and a call to action to address climate-related risks and opportunities, ultimately contributing to the transition to a low-carbon, climate-resilient economy. The guidebook also provides a range of methodological approaches and resources for NDBs to assess climate risks, including scenario analysis, case studies, and externally derived assessments. These tools enable NDBs to gain a clearer understanding of their vulnerability and exposure to climate risk and inform their financial and strategic decisions. The guidebook also addresses the methodological challenges of climate risk assessment and highlights the evolving nature of climate risk assessment and the need for innovative approaches. Additionally, it provides a list of tools and resources for climate risk assessment, scenario analysis, and climate risk disclosure, offering NDBs a comprehensive set of resources to enhance their climate risk management capabilities. Overall, the guidebook offers a compelling and practical framework for NDBs to proactively address climate-related financial risks and integrate climate considerations into their operations and decision-making processes.']

['21 See https://climatepromise.undp.org/news-and-stories/how-countries-latin-america-and-caribbean-are-financing-their-climate-goals.', '22 See https://www.iadb.org/en/story/sovereign-sustainable-bonds-core-financing-instruments-sustainable-development.', '23 See https://climatedata.imf.org/datasets/8e2772e0b65f4e33a80183ce9583d062/explore', 'OFFICIAL FINANCING FOR THE PRODUCTIVE TRANSITION IN THE ANDEAN REGION 79', 'FINANCING THE PRODUCTIVE TRANSITION IN THE ANDEAN REGION', 'An importance mode of intervention of development finance partners is blended finance.', 'Blended finance combines public or philanthropic interventions with private money on a development project.', 'Blended finance can take the form of equity investments, below-market loans or local currency loans, as well as credit guarantees for the repayment of principal and interest on corporate loans or bonds.', 'As argued by Garbacz et al. (2021), the advantage of guarantees in blended finance is that they do not immediately require outflows of funding including from donors or public entities are not immediately required. .', 'Guarantees are also useful for mitigating commercial, credit, and political risks and help shift the risk-return profile of investments and alleviate credit restrictions for underserved borrowers.', 'Guarantees, including from development banks, are a top priority with regard to scaling up climate investments in CAN-4 countries.', 'Other important instruments that can help bolster markets are insurance schemes which can stimulate risk taking.', 'A third source of climate investment is impact investing, which could be particularly fitting for economies with relatively small private sectors.', 'Impact investors provide capital to companies and organizations that enable them to achieve social and environmental goals.']

['The document "New Horizons for Productive Transformation in the Andean Region" presents a compelling narrative on the financing dynamics for the productive transition in the Andean countries. It offers a comprehensive analysis of the roles of public and private investments, the impact of stranded assets and technological changes, and the need for innovative financial systems. The document emphasizes the importance of climate financing as a central axis to achieve decarbonization goals and highlights the significance of solid regulatory frameworks and national and international collaboration in mobilizing necessary resources.

The analysis explores potential scenarios and their impact on the Andean economies, offering valuable insights into the challenges and opportunities presented by the energy transition. It underscores the need for technological innovation and citizen participation, emphasizing the importance of social acceptance and technological adaptation.

The document provides a clear roadmap that underscores the need for concerted action among governments, the private sector, and civil society. It also identifies specific strengths and areas for improvement in each Andean country, offering the possibility of south-south cooperation and knowledge transfer.

Furthermore, the document evaluates the readiness of the financial systems in the Andean countries for climate finance, highlighting the progress, challenges, and opportunities in each country. It also describes the current supply of green financial products in the region, identifying variations in the offer of these products between the countries.

In conclusion, the document offers a compelling narrative for policymakers, investors, and stakeholders involved in the region's productive transformation, emphasizing the need for cooperation, standardization, and expansion of sustainable financial products to achieve a more sustainable and resilient future in the Andean region.']

['In the case of the IDB and WB, about 30% of this financing is associated with climate change (IDB, 2020; WB, 2021).', 'In total, international climate finance for Latin America and the Caribbean reached an estimated $35 billion annually on average in 2019 and 2020 (IPC, 2021).', 'These bilateral or multilateral funds were also instrumental in channeling more resources into various projects; for example, for every US$1 of IDB financing, additional resources of US$2.6 were mobilized (Viguri, et al., 2020).', 'The OECD estimates that climate finance from developed countries to those in the region totaled US$12.4 billion in 2019 (OECD, 2021b).', 'OECD estimates of the amounts lent by multilateral banks are 14', "weighted by the donor countries' share in its capital, making it possible to estimate the flows that contribute to meeting developed countries' pledge of $100 billion per year to fight climate change in developing countries.", 'In contrast, the CPI estimates all international finance, even if it is a "south-south" flow.', 'Conclusion Addressing climate change requires long-term planning that goes beyond the commitments set out in the current Nationally Determined Contributions.', 'To meet the goals of the Paris Agreement, the countries of the world collectively will need to transition to a resilient, decarbonized economy in the first half of the 21st century.', 'Fortunately, achieving these goals is not technologically or financially insurmountable since it does not require substantially more expenditure.', 'Moreover, the transition will generate economic benefits that are higher than its costs.', 'Consequently, one challenge is to redirect a large portion of existing financial flows so that they align with the sustainable development goals, including the goals of just transition to a net-zero emissions and resilient economy.']

['The Inter-American Development Bank\'s working paper "How Much Will It Cost to Achieve the Climate Goals in Latin America and the Caribbean?" by Luis Miguel Galindo, Bridget Hoffman, and Adrien Vogt-Schilb presents a comprehensive analysis of the financial implications of addressing climate change in the region. The paper emphasizes the urgent need for a significant redirection of existing financial flows to achieve climate goals and highlights the interconnectedness of climate action with other sustainable development objectives. It underscores the necessity of addressing social spending and ensuring a just transition to a decarbonized and resilient economy. The authors estimate that meeting climate change goals will require substantial annual spending on infrastructure and social challenges, representing a significant portion of the region\'s GDP. The paper also discusses specific financing sources and the role of development banks in supporting the necessary investments and reforms. Overall, the working paper provides a compelling and urgent call to action for governments, the private sector, and international institutions to realign financial flows and policies to achieve climate and sustainability goals in the region. This analysis is crucial for informing policy decisions and mobilizing resources to address the pressing climate challenges in Latin America and the Caribbean.']

expected_output: Climate finance refers to the financial resources allocated to support the transition to a low-carbon, climate-resilient economy. This includes funding for climate-smart infrastructure, renewable energy, energy efficiency, and low-carbon transport initiatives. It encompasses various financial instruments such as medium- to long-term debt, capital, grants, and technical assistance aimed at helping countries diversify their economies towards sustainable development paths. In Latin America and the Caribbean, climate finance is crucial for achieving climate goals and is supported by development banks, which play a significant role in mobilizing necessary investments and reforms. The Inter-American Development Bank (IDB) and other institutions have been instrumental in increasing green financing, with estimates indicating that international climate finance for the region reached approximately $35 billion annually in recent years [Source 5].

input.question: quais são as principais recomendações de política de genero para brasil?

contexts.text: ['In Brazil, few companies do politically correct advertising on TV that would promote women’s rights and racial and ethnic diversity.', 'The Federal Government has used the media to send messages against domestic violence and in favor of sexual health, but not to promote the sharing of domestic tasks and child care by men and women.', 'It is also essential to understand that the positions occupied by elected women, whether in the legislative or executive powers, are public positions usually connected with a speciﬁ c political project.', 'This means that feminist proposals must establish a dialogue with other social proposals, such as human development and ecological sustainability, in order to construct wider projects for society as a whole.', 'The incorporation and ongoing practice of a gender perspective requires that we continually monitor : men and women ’s commitment to social development processes ; the results of development programs for men and women ; female and male perspectives on gender stereotypes ; the relations between men and women ,', 'and the relations among men and among women .', 'Bibliography Alexandre de Gusmão Foundation.', '2003.', 'Women’s defense: International instruments.', 'Brasília:', 'Funag: IPRI: Ministry of External Relations.', 'Araújo, Clara. 2003.', 'The intersection between gender and political parties regarding women’s access to representation instances.', 'Article presented in the National Meeting of Political Parties’ Women’s Instances, May 19-20, Brasília/DF, Brazil.', 'Dossier Women in Politics, Women in Power.', '2001.', 'Feminist Studies Magazine, 9(1): 164-212, Florianopolis.', 'Htun, Mala. 2002.', 'Puzzles of Women’s Rights in Brazil.', 'Social Research, 69(3):815-833.', 'Htun, Mala M., Mark, Jones. 2002.', 'Engendering the right to participate in Decision-making: Electoral Quotas and Women’s Leadership in Latin America.', 'Gender and the Politics of 37596.indd']

['Em teoria, a região cumpriu, mas na prática, ter estes instrumentos disponíveis não garante que os objetivos que motivaram sua criação sejam efetivamente alcançados.', 'Sessenta e nove por cento dos países possuem algum tipo de regulamentação relacionada à igualdade de gênero, que nem sempre traduzem as boas intenções em instrumentos e objetivos concretos de ação.', 'Todos os países analisados têm uma organização dedicada à integração do gênero, mas nem sempre dispõem do orçamento e da influência desejados.', 'Com exceção da Guiana, todos têm políticas para promover a igualdade de gênero e, em alguns, existem políticas específicas para promover a inclusão de mulheres em cargos de gestão no setor público, mas os resultados não são tangíveis.', 'O setor público poderia ser a referência em cada país para o que significa superar a brecha de gênero.', 'Isso requer vontade política e a priorização de ações concretas, mensuráveis e realizáveis.', 'É hora de medir o progresso nas questões de gênero em termos de resultados, não simplesmente adotando normas, padrões e políticas que, na prática, não levam a mudanças significativas.', 'Este estudo propõe três linhas concretas de ação: 1.', 'Quebrar barreiras de acesso para alcançar a igualdade formal nos cargos de tomada de decisão.', 'O primeiro desafio', 'é fomentar o acesso das mulheres a cargos de liderança.']

['The paper "Women’s Mobilization in Bulacan and Payatas for Community Development: A Study in Contrast and Convergence" provides a captivating portrayal of the proactive involvement of women in driving community development in the Philippines. The paper commences with a vivid scene in a community kitchen in Peru, effectively illustrating the daily challenges and efforts of women in providing meals for their families and neighbors. This engaging introduction sets the stage for a deeper exploration of the experiences and achievements of women in propelling positive change in their communities.

The study aims to highlight the motivations that prompt women to take action and the diverse strategies they employ to drive change, showcasing the outcomes of their active participation and involvement in community development initiatives. Through this narrative, the paper sets the tone for a comprehensive analysis of the power of women's mobilization for social development, offering valuable insights into the role of women in fostering broader social transformation.

Furthermore, the study delves into the institutionalization of women's issues and the mechanisms in place to monitor and implement international agreements and national legislation, shedding light on the progress made and the challenges that still need to be addressed. This paper provides a compelling and insightful exploration of the pivotal role of women in driving community development, offering valuable lessons and inspiration for similar initiatives globally.']

['E DO CARIBE LACUNAS E OPORTUNIDADES tem diferentes ferramentas, como por exemplo: medidas de ação afirmativa através de concursos somente para mulheres, elaboração de perfis de trabalho neutros, processos de seleção cegos, em que o gênero dos participantes não é considerado.', '2.', 'Promover as condições para alcançar a igualdade substantiva, com a participação ativa das mulheres na tomada de decisões e', 'no ciclo das políticas públicas Como esta análise demonstrou, não basta alcançar a paridade numérica, uma vez que as mulheres não estão incluídas nos processos de tomada de decisões no setor público.', 'São necessárias burocracias ativas.', 'A presença de mulheres na concepção e implementação de políticas públicas não responde apenas a um critério de igualdade, mas também de eficiência.', 'A força do setor público pode ser usada para gerar um círculo virtuoso que cria o espaço e as condições para implementar uma agenda de gênero mais ambiciosa.', '1.', 'Utilizar os instrumentos existentes para a transversalização de políticas de gênero e fortalecê-los.', 'Não basta criar MANs e ter PIOs, se os órgãos estatais não têm capacidade de execução.', 'Uma agenda de gênero eficaz deve priorizar o fortalecimento da capacidade do Estado para priorizar ações estratégicas, criar metas e objetivos concretos, monitorar seu avanço e agir oportunamente quando for necessário.', 'Instrumentos existentes, como a implementação de unidades de cumprimento (delivery units)', 'nos MAMs, poderiam ajudar a concretizar resultados.']

['O estudo "Mulheres Líderes no Setor Público da América Latina e do Caribe: Lacunas e Oportunidades" destaca a importância da participação feminina em cargos de liderança na administração pública. Apesar da representação significativa das mulheres na força de trabalho do setor público, sua presença em cargos de decisão ainda é limitada. A segregação vertical e horizontal persiste, com as mulheres concentradas em setores específicos e sub-representadas nos níveis mais altos de tomada de decisão. Diante disso, o estudo propõe três linhas concretas de ação: quebrar barreiras de acesso para alcançar a igualdade formal nos cargos de tomada de decisão, facilitar as condições para a igualdade substantiva e implementar um monitoramento permanente da presença de mulheres em cargos de liderança no setor público. Essas ações visam não apenas aumentar a representatividade das mulheres, mas também eliminar a segregação de gênero e promover uma participação ativa que aproveite o talento feminino na região. Este estudo fornece uma visão abrangente das lacunas existentes e das oportunidades disponíveis para promover a igualdade de gênero e a participação feminina nos mais altos escalões do setor público na América Latina e no Caribe. As recomendações apresentadas têm o potencial de criar mudanças significativas e duradouras, beneficiando não apenas as mulheres, mas também a eficácia e a representatividade da administração pública na região.']

expected_output: As principais recomendações de política de gênero para o Brasil incluem: 1. Quebrar barreiras de acesso para alcançar a igualdade formal nos cargos de tomada de decisão, promovendo o acesso das mulheres a posições de liderança através de medidas como concursos exclusivamente para mulheres e processos de seleção cegos, onde o gênero não é considerado [Source 4]. 2. Promover condições para alcançar a igualdade substantiva, garantindo a participação ativa das mulheres na tomada de decisões e no ciclo das políticas públicas, pois a presença feminina na concepção e implementação de políticas não é apenas uma questão de igualdade, mas também de eficiência [Source 4]. 3. Utilizar e fortalecer os instrumentos existentes para a transversalização de políticas de gênero, priorizando o fortalecimento da capacidade do Estado para criar metas concretas e monitorar seu progresso [Source 4].

input.question: Que podemos hacer para disminuir las pérdidas técnicas en la provision de agua portable en Paraguay?

contexts.text: ['X. ASEGURAR LA SOSTENIBILIDAD AMBIENTAL introducción de tarifas que cubran los costos de operación , financiación y rehabilitación de infraestructura , tomando en cuenta la disponibilidad de pago de los diferentes sectores de la población ) , y programas especiales para atender las necesidades de los más pobres ( ver', 'proyecto de Guatemala en el recuadro 6 ) .', 'Estrategias, políticas y programas del BID para aumentar el acceso a agua potable y a servicios sanitarios La acción del Banco en el sector se enfoca en apoyar a los países en cumplir con los Objetivos de Desarrollo del Milenio.', 'Para ello, el Banco ha preparado guías operacionales para la aplicación de la Política de servicios públicos domiciliarios al sector de agua y saneamiento.', 'Asimismo, los departamentos operativos han elaborado estrategias subregionales con el objeto de realzar los esfuerzos en el sector.', 'Los objetivos establecidos en estas estrategias son : ( i ) aumentar la cobertura de los servicios de agua potable y saneamiento ; ( ii ) apoyar a los países en la formulación de planes de acción para cumplir con los Objetivos de Desarrollo del Milenio ; ( iii )', 'mejorar la calidad de los servicios mediante inversiones en fortalecimiento institucional de proveedores de servicios y desarrollo y fortalecimiento de marcos regulatorios ; y ( iv ) promoción de principios de sostenibilidad y eficiencia a largo plazo .']

['The report "LOS OBJETIVOS DE DESARROLLO DEL MILENIO EN AMÉRICA LATINA Y EL CARIBE" provides a comprehensive analysis of the progress, challenges, and commitments related to the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) in the Latin American and Caribbean region. Under the leadership of Carlos M. Jarque, the report delves into the region's efforts to achieve macroeconomic stability, implement structural reforms, and improve social conditions, while also addressing persistent challenges of inequality and social exclusion. It emphasizes the urgent need to address these obstacles to ensure sustainable development and effectively reduce poverty.

The report outlines the Inter-American Development Bank's (IDB) commitment to integrating the MDGs into its financing and support for member countries, emphasizing the importance of coherent policies and programs to achieve these goals. It also underscores the IDB's focus on supporting capacity-building, monitoring, and evaluation efforts to track progress towards the MDGs.

This report serves as a valuable resource for policymakers, development practitioners, and stakeholders, offering insights into the region's development priorities and the IDB's role in advancing the MDGs. It provides a detailed overview of the region's current status and the actions taken by the IDB to support the countries in achieving these goals. The report also highlights the challenges and opportunities for the region in addressing poverty, inequality, and social exclusion, and offers recommendations for recalibrating social development goals to better reflect the region's specific needs and realities.']

['Esto requerirá de marcos regulatorios alineados con prácticas internacionales de gestión de riesgos; sistemas de credit scoring para minimizar asimetrías de información; esquemas de apoyo a la vivienda mediante mecanismos articulados de subsidio estatal y financiamiento de la banca privada.', '3.', 'Mejorar calidad y cobertura desigual de la provisión de agua y saneamiento - Aumentar las inversiones en alcantarillado y tratamiento de aguas residuales, iniciando principalmente en las zonas del país con mayor aglomeración urbana (Área Metropolitana de Asunción, Alto Paraná, Itapúa).', '- Incrementar la micro-medición, reducir el derroche de agua y las pérdidas comerciales y operativas en la red, incrementar la eficiencia energética, implementar programas de mantenimiento preventivo de activos y la revisión de la gestión comercial.', '- Actualizar esquemas tarifarios sobre la base de los costos reales de prestación de los servicios y reformar las estructuras tarifarias para vincularlas a los niveles de consumo con el objetivo de promover la eficiencia de gestión , la responsabilidad en el uso , la conservación del recurso y el', 'correcto dimensionamiento de las obras .', '- Apoyar el posicionamiento de la DAPSAN como entidad a cargo de la formulación de las políticas sectoriales, la planificación de mediano y largo plazo de las inversiones y los servicios, la definición de tarifas, y de las estrategias de financiamiento asociadas.', '- Fortalecer las funciones de regulación y control, y establecer mecanismos para mejorar la transparencia de gestión de las autoridades responsables y de los prestadores.']

['El informe "Paraguay: Transitando hacia el desarrollo sostenible" ofrece una visión integral de la situación económica y social de Paraguay, identificando desafíos y oportunidades para el desarrollo sostenible del país. A pesar de los avances en la reducción de la pobreza y la estabilidad macroeconómica, Paraguay se encuentra en un punto crucial en el que es necesario acelerar las reformas para impulsar un crecimiento sostenible. El informe destaca tres pilares estratégicos clave: inversión en capital humano, desarrollo productivo e inserción internacional, y gestión pública y transparencia. Además, ofrece recomendaciones de política para cerrar las brechas en estas áreas y contribuir al diálogo estratégico en Paraguay. El documento también aborda el impacto de la pandemia en la economía y las finanzas públicas, destacando la necesidad de un plan de consolidación fiscal gradual para garantizar la sostenibilidad a largo plazo. A pesar de los desafíos identificados, el informe reconoce los logros sociales de Paraguay, como la reducción de la pobreza y la expansión de la clase media, pero también señala la persistencia de desafíos como la informalidad laboral, la desigualdad de género y las inequidades territoriales. En resumen, el informe ofrece una hoja de ruta para el desarrollo sostenible en los próximos años, destacando la importancia de la colaboración entre el sector público y privado para alcanzar un crecimiento inclusivo y sostenible.']

['Avanzar en programas para la reducción del agua no contabilizada (pérdidas físicas y aparentes)', 'y la instalación del equipamiento necesario para la desinfección del agua en todos los sistemas que lo requieren para cumplir con las normas de calidad establecidas.', '•', 'Entrenar al personal encargado de la operación.', '•', 'Promover la sostenibilidad y generar capacidades técnicas en la fuerza laboral del sector.', '4 . Mejorar la gestión de los servicios • Adaptar y utilizar los mecanismos de participación aplicados en el programa de agua potable y saneamiento para comunidades rurales e indígenas que incluyan consultas para el consentimiento libre , previo e informado de las comunidades originarias beneficiarias , creando Juntas de', 'Saneamiento y Comisiones de Saneamiento , para garantizar el cumplimiento de los derechos de los pueblos indígenas .', '•', 'Prestadores pequeños y medianos : promover su formalización bajo criterios de sostenibilidad técnica , financiera , social y ambiental ; identificar e impulsar estrategias de aglomeración entre prestadores para reducir la atomización y generar economías de escala ; y atender en forma prioritaria el establecimiento de un esquema de asistencia', 'técnica permanente .', '•', 'Adaptar las estrategias de género utilizadas en el programa de agua potable y saneamiento para el Chaco y la región Oriental del Paraguay para garantizar la participación de las mujeres en los espacios de toma de decisiones.']

['El informe "Paraguay: Rutas para el Desarrollo" ofrece un análisis exhaustivo del progreso económico, social y medioambiental de Paraguay, identificando desafíos y oportunidades clave para el desarrollo sostenible del país. A pesar del notable crecimiento económico experimentado, Paraguay se enfrenta a desafíos en áreas como la integración comercial, la infraestructura, el capital humano y la gestión pública. El Banco Interamericano de Desarrollo (BID) ha identificado estas áreas como prioritarias para el desarrollo inclusivo y sostenible del país, y se compromete a ser un socio estratégico en este proceso. El informe destaca la necesidad de promover la internacionalización de la economía, mejorar la infraestructura productiva y social, potenciar la acumulación de capital humano y fortalecer la gestión pública e institucional. Además, resalta el potencial de Paraguay para convertirse en un ejemplo de desarrollo sostenible en la región. El documento proporciona una hoja de ruta clara para el desarrollo de Paraguay, destacando la importancia de la colaboración entre el sector público y privado, y subrayando el papel crucial del BID como aliado estratégico en este proceso de transformación.']

expected_output: Para disminuir las pérdidas técnicas en la provisión de agua potable en Paraguay, se pueden implementar varias estrategias. Primero, es crucial aumentar la micro-medición y reducir el derroche de agua, así como las pérdidas comerciales y operativas en la red de distribución [Source 3]. Además, se debe incrementar la eficiencia energética y llevar a cabo programas de mantenimiento preventivo de los activos [Source 3]. También es importante actualizar los esquemas tarifarios basados en los costos reales de prestación de servicios, lo que promovería la eficiencia en la gestión y la conservación del recurso [Source 3]. Por último, se deben avanzar en programas para la reducción del agua no contabilizada, que incluye tanto pérdidas físicas como aparentes [Source 5]. Estas acciones, junto con la capacitación del personal encargado de la operación y la promoción de la sostenibilidad, contribuirán significativamente a mejorar la situación [Source 5].

input.question: Summarize the causes of inflation in. The last 10 years in Argentina

contexts.text: ['Outlays linked directly or indirectly to military operations and programs contributed to fiscal imbalances ( see Figure 3.9 ) , and those large fiscal deficits were behind levels of inflation for the whole period that remained well above the historical averages ( surpassed only by the inflationary explosions of 1975', '- 76 , as shown in Figure 3.4 ) .', 'In addition, because inflation remained high, the Olivera-Tanzi effect (i.e., the losses in revenues in non-indexed tax systems due to lags in collection when prices are increasing rapidly) worked against the possibility of placing fiscal accounts under control.', 'High inflation was a permanent problem for the economic team of the military government.', 'Besides the economic inefficiencies and waste of resources generated by high inflation, it was also eroding whatever legitimacy the regime may have had before the public, as the need to control inflation had been one of the main rationales for justifying the 1976 coup.', 'EXCHANGE RATE POLICIES IN ARGENTINA 79 Figure 3.9.', 'Fiscal Deficits as a Percentage of GOP By the end of 1978, inflation continued unabated at about 150 percent per year, and the economy was in recession.', 'The failure to achieve the main objective of non-inflationary growth that the military government had set for itself fueled the search for new approaches.', 'This came in the form of the economic package of December 1978.', 'The 1978 Program Copyright © by the Inter-American Development Bank.', 'All rights reserved.', 'For more information visit our website : www.iadb.org/pub This program aimed to break inflationary expectations and reduce uncertainties through the pre - announcement of three main variables controlled by the government : the devaluation rate ( the schedule was known as the tablita ) , the prices of goods and', 'services provided by public enterprises , and minimum wages .']

['The conduct of monetary policy was further complicated by the opening up of the capital account, the continuous dollarization of the economy, and the newly liberalized but poorly regulated financial sector.', 'Moreover, because inflation generally remained high during this period, the Olivera-Tanzi effect worked against the possibility of placing fiscal accounts under control.', 'In the context of a weak fiscal and financial position, the full liberalization of the capital account in 1978 opened a new chapter.', "The currency became the target of speculative attacks along the lines of Krugman's model (1979) and extended in Calvo (1996), leading to further dollarization of the economy and to recurrent and sudden depletions of foreign exchange reserves.", 'With the return to democracy, the Radical Party, trying to woo the labor sector, a traditional Peronist bastion, increased salaries while trying to maintain a competitive exchange rate, which exacerbated inflation.', 'When policies were changed with the 1985 Austral Plan, it was clear that an anti-inflationary posture yielded important electoral rewards, and the Alfonsin administration won the first mid-term election in that year.', 'However, the economic and political conflict regarding use of the exchange rate as a nominal anchor to tame inflation, or as a real price to allocate real resources, continued unresolved during the Radical government.', "The collapse of world agricultural prices in the second half of the 1980s added to the administration's economic difficulties.", 'The combination of all these factors led to more fre', 'EXCHANGE RATE POLICIES IN ARGENTINA 111', 'Copyright © by the Inter-American Development Bank.', 'All rights reserved.', 'For more information visit our website: www.iadb.org/pub quent and more explosive crises.', 'The electoral defeats of the Radical Party were related to high and accelerating inflation that culminated in the hyperinflationary episode of 1989.', 'The politics of redistribution was thus displaced by the politics of (hyper)inflation.']

['"The Currency Game: Exchange Rate Politics in Latin America" offers a compelling and insightful analysis of exchange rate policies in the region, providing valuable insights into the intricate interplay of economic and political factors shaping exchange rate decisions. The book delves into the historical context of exchange rate policy, identifying the tradeoff between the balance of payments and inflation, and the influence of political economy variables on regime changes. It explores the impact of economic structure, macroeconomic conditions, interest groups, political institutions, and electoral considerations on exchange rate policies.

The comprehensive analysis of exchange rate policies in five Latin American countries provides a rich understanding of the factors at play, offering a valuable resource for policymakers, economists, and researchers seeking to understand the dynamics and implications of exchange rate policies in the region. Additionally, the book discusses the challenges and implications of abandoning an exchange rate peg, providing valuable insights into the political and economic costs associated with such decisions.

Furthermore, the narrative provides a detailed historical account of Peru's exchange rate policies over the past 50 years, offering a rich analysis of the country's experiences with various exchange rate regimes and their impact on economic development. Overall, "The Currency Game" is an essential resource for anyone interested in understanding the complexities and nuances of exchange rate politics in Latin America.']

['The combination of the monetary reforms, a major fiscal adjustment and far reaching structural reforms succeeded in bringing down inflation and restoring growth.', 'Today Argentina enjoys low rates of inflation and high rates of growth, an enviable situation by almost any standards.', 'This long history of high inflation and lack of rules had very negative implications for the development of the domestic capital market.', 'First, it led to capital flight, as Argentines sent their money abroad to protect themselves from possible capital losses resulting from taxation or inflation.', 'While figures on capital flight are difficult to determine precisely, it has been estimated that in the mid-eighties Argentines held over 60 billion dollars abroad, a figure larger than the size of the Argentine banking system at the time.', 'Second, the recurrent episodes of inflation and devaluation and the lack of financial instruments to protect savers in a credible manner from the variability in policies essentially eliminated the role of the peso as a saving instrument.', 'By the late eighties the economy had become fully dollarized as this currency was used as unit of account, store of value and medium of exchange.', 'The overall environment for the capital markets started to change in the nineties as the country recovered macroeconomic stability and maintained a fixed exchange rate since the convertibility plan in 1991.', 'The convertibility law validated the use of the dollar in the economy as it made it legal to use that currency in local contracts.', 'This decision was particularly important as it allowed to bring on shore many financial transactions and allowed the growth of the domestic banking system and other financial institutions with instrument in pesos and dollars.', 'The restructuring of foreign debt through the Brady plan was another important step in regaining access to the voluntary capital market, as it provided a long-term solution to the debt overhang.', 'In addition, it removed the uncertainties associated with debt that was already in default.', 'Argentina offered 10', 'three alternative bonds to pay its debts.']

['The Inter-American Development Bank (IDB) Working Paper #364, "Debt Management: Some Reflections Based on Argentina" by Miguel A. Kiguel, Undersecretary of Finance for the Argentina Republic, provides a comprehensive analysis of debt management strategies and their impact on emerging economies. Drawing on Argentina's experience, the paper offers valuable insights into the complexities and trade-offs involved in debt management. It emphasizes the importance of sound liability management strategies in reducing borrowing costs, ensuring access to international capital markets, and minimizing crowding out effects on private sector borrowing.

The paper delves into Argentina's unique debt structure, including the challenge of accurately measuring the size of external debt due to the significant portion of domestic debt denominated in dollars. It also highlights the country's diverse natural resources and high-value exports, which differentiate its capacity to generate foreign exchange from other nations. The paper underscores the importance of credit ratings, fiscal discipline, and the interplay between solvency and liquidity in overcoming financial crises.

Furthermore, the paper provides valuable policy implications for debt management, emphasizing the need for a comprehensive strategy that balances borrowing costs, credit ratings, and access to international markets. It also advocates for the explicit design of a sound liability management strategy to reduce overall borrowing costs and ensure good access to international capital markets. The paper concludes by stressing the importance of understanding how to measure country risks and credit ratings, particularly in the context of Argentina's bi-monetary economy and diversified natural endowments.']

expected_output: In the last decade, inflation in Argentina has been driven by several interrelated factors. Firstly, persistent fiscal deficits have contributed significantly to inflationary pressures, as large deficits often lead to increased money supply to finance government spending, which in turn fuels inflation [Source 2]. Additionally, the Olivera-Tanzi effect has exacerbated the situation; this phenomenon occurs when inflation erodes the real value of tax revenues, making it difficult for the government to control fiscal accounts [Source 2]. Furthermore, the liberalization of the capital account and the dollarization of the economy have complicated monetary policy, leading to speculative attacks on the currency and further inflation [Source 2]. Lastly, political instability and inconsistent economic policies have undermined public confidence, contributing to inflation expectations and a lack of effective measures to stabilize prices [Source 4].

["The Public Environmental Expenditure Review in Peru 2008-2013 provides a comprehensive analysis of the country's environmental expenditures, offering valuable insights into the allocation and effectiveness of public funds in environmental management. The report delves into the institutional landscape at national, regional, and municipal levels, shedding light on the country's environmental challenges and the government's efforts to address them. It aims to enhance the efficiency and coherence of public expenditure in environmental management, ultimately contributing to sustainable development.

The review covers a wide range of topics, including the evolution of Peru's natural resource management framework, the distribution of environmental spending across different government levels, and the allocation of funds across various environmental management activities. It also highlights the occurrence and increasing frequency of socio-environmental conflicts, particularly those related to mining and hydrocarbon activities, shedding light on the complex challenges facing environmental management in the country.

Furthermore, the report provides a detailed analysis of environmental licensing, monitoring, and enforcement activities, revealing the concentration of expenditure in national government institutions and the challenges associated with increasing expenditure effectiveness. It also addresses the status of water resources and wastewater management, emphasizing the unequal distribution of water resources and the impact of water pollution on public health.

Overall, the review offers a compelling narrative of Peru's environmental expenditure landscape, providing a foundation for informed decision-making and policy formulation to drive sustainable environmental management. The findings indicate a significant increase in total public environmental expenditure, reflecting the government's commitment to environmental protection and sustainable development. However, the report also highlights the need to address various challenges to enhance the effectiveness of environmental expenditure and ensure the sustainable management of Peru's natural resources."]

['It constructs a timeline of investments, looks at the amounts and sources of funding, identifies the main objectives and themes, and describes how the projects came into being.', '1The Inter - American Development Bank Group comprises the Inter - American Development Bank ( IDB ) , IDB Invest ( the commercial name of the Inter - American Investment Corporation ) , and IDB LAB ( the commercial name of the Multilateral Investment Fund , which is administered by', 'the IDBG ) .', 'In this paper we do not differentiate among these different entities and group all three as IDBG.', '169', 'Forest Projects at the Inter-American Development Bank Background', 'The IDBG was founded in 1959 as a partnership between 19 Latin American countries and the United States.', 'Today it is owned by 48 member states, of which 26 are borrowing members in LAC.', 'These 26 borrowing members together have slightly more than 50 percent of the voting power on the IDBG board.', '“As the world’s oldest and largest regional multilateral development bank, the IDBG is the main source of multilateral financing for economic, social, and institutional development in Latin America and the Caribbean” (IDBG 2019, ii).', 'By the end of 2018, the IDBG had approved more than US $286 billion in loans and guarantees to finance projects with investments totaling $567 billion, as well as $7.3 billion in grants.', 'In 2018 alone, the IDBG approved $14.25 billion in loans (IDBG 2019).', 'Project Funding Projects are funded mostly through two financial instruments, loans and grants.', 'Loans The funding for loans usually comes from IDBG ordinary capital.', 'The IDBG has an ordinary capital of US $105 billion, 96 percent of which consists of callable capital and 4 percent is paid by member countries.2', 'Managing these funds is the core business of the IDBG.', 'It lends to member countries usually through sovereign guaranteed (public) loans or through private sector loans.']

['The monograph "Latin American and Caribbean Forests in the 2020s: Trends, Challenges, and Opportunities" offers a compelling analysis of the critical issues facing the region\'s forests. Authored by a team of experts, the monograph emphasizes the vital ecosystem services and economic significance of the region\'s forests, while shedding light on the urgent challenges of deforestation and climate change. The executive summary provides a glimpse into the expert assessments presented in the monograph, discussing potential opportunities for sustainable management and conservation. It delves into the effectiveness of different approaches to forest conservation and restoration, the two-way links between forests and climate change, trends in forest management and trade, and an analysis of the Inter-American Development Bank\'s (IDB) experience with forest projects. The summary also emphasizes the urgency of addressing climate change and the slow progress in reducing deforestation, particularly in Latin America and the Caribbean. This summary sets the stage for a deeper exploration of the monograph\'s valuable insights, making a compelling case for the importance of sustainable forest management and conservation in the region.']

['Geneva, Switzerland: UNDP.', 'INTER-AMERICAN DEVELOPMENT BANK 115', 'ABOUT THE IDB We work to improve lives in Latin America and the Caribbean.', 'Through financial and technical support for countries working to reduce poverty and inequality, we help improve health and education, and advance infrastructure.', 'Our aim is to achieve development in a sustainable, climate-friendly way.', 'With a history dating back to 1959, today we are the leading source of development financing for Latin America and the Caribbean.', 'We provide loans, grants, and technical assistance; and we conduct extensive research.', 'We maintain a strong commitment to achieving measurable results and the highest standards of increased integrity, transparency, and accountability.', "The Bank 's current focus areas include three development challenges — social inclusion and inequality , productivity and innovation , and economic integration — and three cross - cutting issues — gender equality and diversity , climate change and environmental sustainability , and institutional capacity and the rule of law", '.', 'WWW.IADB.ORG']

['"Macro Impact with Micro Money" is a compelling testament to the Inter-American Development Bank\'s (IDB) 25-year dedication to fostering microenterprise development in Latin America and the Caribbean. The book celebrates the transformative impact of the Small Projects Program and the Social Entrepreneurship Program, which have provided vital support to over 500,000 low-income individuals, including women, indigenous peoples, and small producers. It showcases the success stories of microenterprises, producer associations, and cooperatives, emphasizing their role in empowering excluded sectors and promoting development activities. The programs have not only offered financial support but have also contributed to institutional strengthening and lending activities for more than 500 entities, many of which are now leading players in the microfinance industry. The book pays tribute to the implementers of these projects and their beneficiaries, shedding light on the evolution of the programs, their impact on various sectors, and the innovative approaches adopted to address the diverse needs of the region\'s less-favored communities. Through these initiatives, the IDB has mobilized significant resources and support services, reaching thousands of microentrepreneurs and small businesses operating throughout the region. "Macro Impact with Micro Money" celebrates the IDB\'s pioneering role in supporting microenterprise development and its enduring impact on the economic and social landscape of Latin America and the Caribbean.']

expected_output: The Inter-American Development Bank (IDB) is the oldest and largest regional multilateral development bank, founded in 1959. It serves as a primary source of multilateral financing for economic, social, and institutional development in Latin America and the Caribbean. The IDB provides loans, grants, and technical assistance to help countries reduce poverty and inequality, improve health and education, and advance infrastructure, all while focusing on sustainable and climate-friendly development. As of the end of 2018, the IDB had approved over $286 billion in loans and guarantees, with a total investment exceeding $567 billion, reflecting its significant role in the region's development efforts [Source 3].

Rusticucci , 2022 : Central and South', 'America .', 'Em: Climate Change 2022:', 'Impacts, Adaptation, and Vulnerability. .']
